alert.note: Alert for Bradford; Wyoming (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 8:26AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Bradford and western Wyoming Counties through 900 AM EDT... At 826 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lovelton, or 11 miles south of Wyalusing, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tunkhannock, Wilmot, Hollenback, Mehoopany, Meshoppen, Forkston, Laceyville, Kasson Brook, Osterhout and Lovelton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
